muclient.aliases: <alias match="^ *&cmdPrefix; +config +vol +(?\d+) *$" enabled="y" script="Config.volume" regexp="y" ignore_case="y" sequence="100" >
muclient.script:
require("commas") require("serialize") require("tprint") require("var") require("wait")
require("fk_event") local const = require("fk_const") require("fk_note")
-------------------------------------------------- -- Config --------------------------------------------------
Config = {}
function Config.initialize() Config.load() end
function Config.default() local data = { -- Global volume. volume = 100,
-- Individual sound event config. events = {}, }
data.events.osay = { desc = "OOC say in your room", defaultWav = {"osay"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.otell = { desc = "Send/receive OOC tells", defaultWav = {"otell"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.say = { desc = "Say and sayto in your room", defaultWav = {"say"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.tell = { desc = "Send/receive tells", defaultWav = {"tell"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.yell = { desc = "Yells in your area", defaultWav = {"yell"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.engage = { desc = "Combat engagements", defaultWav = {"engage"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.death = { desc = "Other mob and PC deaths", defaultWav = {"death_other"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.improvement = { desc = "Skill improvements", defaultWav = {"improve"}, volume = 100, panning = 0, } data.events.injury = { desc = "Injured in combat", defaultWav = {"hurt#7"}, volume = 65, panning = 0, }
return serialize.save_simple(data) end
function Config.load() local strvar = var.config or Config.default() local data = loadstring("return " .. strvar)() Config.data = data end
function Config.save() var.config = serialize.save_simple(Config.data) end
function Config.get(key) return Config.data[key] end
function Config.set(key, val) Config.data[key] = val Config.save() end
function Config.get_event(event) return Config.get("events")[event] end
function Config.set_event(event, key, val) local eventData = assert( Config.get_event(event), string.format("Invalid event name: %s.", event) ) local validKeys = { customWav = "string", volume = "number", panning = "number", } assert( validKeys[key], string.format("Invalid setting %s for sound event.", key) ) assert( type(val) == validKeys[key], string.format( "Sound event setting %s must have a value of type %s.", key, validKeys[key] ) )
eventData[key] = val Config.save() end
function Config.volume(alias, line, wc) local volume = tonumber(wc.volume) or Config.get("volume") -- Max volume of 100. volume = math.min(volume, 100) Config.set("volume", volume) local msg = "Global volume set to %d." Utility.msg_major(msg:format(volume)) end

-------------------------------------------------- -- Soundpack --------------------------------------------------
Soundpack = {}
function Soundpack.calculate_real_volume(volume) local globalVolume = Config.get("volume") -- If global volume is lower, use that instead. local volume = globalVolume < volume and globalVolume or volume return -(40 - 0.4 * volume) end
function Soundpack.format_wav(str) -- Append ".wav" if missing. Also, convert instances of "#" fol- -- lowed by an int to a random value from 1 to that number in the -- file name. Allows playing a random choice among several similar -- sounds. eg, file name of "sword#5" could resolve randomly to -- "sword2.wav", "sword5.wav", etc. if (not str:match("%.wav$")) then str = str .. ".wav" end return str:gsub("#(%d+)", function(d) return math.random(1, d) end) end
function Soundpack.play_sound(file, volume, panning) local code = PlaySound(0, file, false, volume, panning) local ok = code == error_code.eOK if (not ok) then local msg = "Failed to play sound %s:" Utility.msg_major(msg:format(file)) Utility.msg_minor(error_desc[code] .. ".") end return ok end
function Soundpack.event(eventName) local event = Config.get_event(eventName) if (not event) then return false end
local volume = event.volume if (volume == 0 or Config.get("volume") == 0) then -- Sound is muted. Don't play. return false end volume = Soundpack.calculate_real_volume(volume)
local files = event.customWav if (not files or #files == 0) then files = event.defaultWav end
wait.make(function() for _, file in ipairs(files) do file = Soundpack.format_wav(file) Soundpack.play_sound(file, volume, event.panning) if (event.delay and event.delay > 0) then wait.time(event.delay) end end end) return true end

-------------------------------------------------- -- Plugin Callbacks --------------------------------------------------
function OnPluginInstall() Utility.initialize() end
function OnPluginEnable() OnPluginInstall() end
function OnPluginClose() Utility.deinitialize() end
function OnPluginDisable() OnPluginClose() end
function OnPluginBroadcast(msg, id, name, text) if (id ~= const.PLUGIN.EVENT_HANDLER) then return end
local eventPath = utils.split(text, ".") if (msg == const.EVENT_TYPE.COMMUNICATION or msg == const.EVENT_TYPE.IMPROVEMENT) then Soundpack.event(eventPath[2]) return end
if (msg == const.EVENT_TYPE.COMBAT) then if (eventPath[2] == "engage" or eventPath[2] == "death") then Soundpack.event(eventPath[2]) return end local event = fk_event(text) if (event.success) then if (event.position == const.COMBAT_POSITION.DEFENSE) then Soundpack.event("injury") end end end end
